body_html:
@peterjc123
Thanks once again,
So do I need to build PyTorch on Windows with the overflow fix instead of using pip install -c peterjc123? If yes, do you have scripts for building it on windows?

Or did you have something else in mind?

BTW, with respect to cuDNN, I noticed that even with version 5 or 6 the behavior is the same, and also that torch.backends.cudnn.version() returns NONE while

See this also:
https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/memory-usage-leak/5645
https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/does-pytorch-0-2-0-still-support-cudnn-5-1-and-how-to-manage-different-versions-of-cudnn/6852/5

It is stated the system cuDNN has no effect on the PyTorch library, is that the case with the windows version? which cuDNN version are you using?
body_text:
@peterjc123
Thanks once again,
So do I need to build PyTorch on Windows with the overflow fix instead of using pip install -c peterjc123? If yes, do you have scripts for building it on windows?
Or did you have something else in mind?
BTW, with respect to cuDNN, I noticed that even with version 5 or 6 the behavior is the same, and also that torch.backends.cudnn.version()  returns NONE while
See this also:
https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/memory-usage-leak/5645

It is stated the system cuDNN has no effect on the PyTorch library, is that the case with the windows version? which cuDNN version are you using?
body:
@peterjc123 
Thanks once again, 
So do I need to build PyTorch on Windows with the overflow fix instead of using pip install -c peterjc123? If yes, do you have scripts for building it on windows? 

Or did you have something else in mind? 

BTW, with respect to cuDNN, I noticed that even with version 5 or 6 the behavior is the same, and also that ```torch.backends.cudnn.version() ``` returns NONE while 

See this also:
https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/memory-usage-leak/5645
https://discuss.pytorch.org/t/does-pytorch-0-2-0-still-support-cudnn-5-1-and-how-to-manage-different-versions-of-cudnn/6852/5

It is stated the system cuDNN has no effect on the PyTorch library, is that the case with the windows version? which cuDNN version are you using?
